title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 §§ 182-1.15 - Designation and responsibilities of the runaway and homeless youth service coordinator
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 §§ 182-1.15 - Designation and responsibilities of the runaway and homeless youth service coordinator

State Regulations
(a) The county
youth bureau shall designate an individual with appropriate qualifications and
experience to serve as runaway and homeless youth service
coordinator. (b) The county youth
bureau shall develop and maintain written procedures for the specific
responsibilities of the coordinator and shall monitor the coordinator's daily
functions with respect to the performance of such duties. (c) The daily functions of the coordinator
shall include, but shall not be limited to the following: (1)
development and implementation of
municipal plans with the municipality, to improve services for runaway and
homeless youth and their families; (2)
identification assessment and monitoring
of all available municipal resources for runaway and homeless youth and their
families; (3)
ensuring that a
system is in place for responding to inquiries concerning available shelter
space, transportation and services 24 hours per day; (4)
ensuring that program youth have access
to educational services, including transportation; (5)
consideration of requests of runaway
youth, who have appropriate written consent of their parents, guardian or legal
custodian, to remain in runaway and homeless youth shelters beyond the
applicable maximum length of stay period set forth in section
182-1.9
(d)(3)
of
this Subpart; (6)
provision of
written notification to the municipality of his or her approval for any youth
to remain in a runaway and homeless youth shelter beyond the applicable maximum
length of stay period set forth in section
182-1.9
(d) of this

Subpart; and
(7)
when designated by
the municipality, after obtaining the information needed from the residential
runaway and homeless youth crisis services program, provide the 60-day written
notice to the office of any youth staying beyond the applicable length of stay
period as required under section
182-1.9
(d)(5)
of
this Subpart. Notes
